meanings.definition: The ability of a material to undergo significant deformation without fracturing.
meanings.sent1: The superplasticity of the metal allowed it to be stretched without breaking.
meanings.sent2: The superplasticity of the clay made it easy to mold into different shapes.
meanings.sent3: The superplasticity of the rubber band made it the perfect candidate for a slingshot.
meanings.sent4: Her mind had a superplasticity that allowed her to adapt to any situation effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The superplasticity of the fabric made it ideal for creating stretchy yoga pants.

meanings.definition: The property of being able to be formed into complex shapes at high temperatures.
meanings.sent1: The superplasticity of the glass at high temperatures allowed for intricate glassblowing.
meanings.sent2: The superplasticity of the metal at high temperatures enabled the creation of detailed sculptures.
meanings.sent3: The superplasticity of the chocolate at high temperatures made it perfect for elaborate cake decorations.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas had a superplasticity at high temperatures, allowing her to create complex strategies.
meanings.sent5: The superplasticity of the plastic at high temperatures made it versatile for molding into various shapes.

meanings.definition: The state of being highly ductile and easily molded.
meanings.sent1: The superplasticity of the putty made it simple to shape into different forms.
meanings.sent2: The superplasticity of the dough allowed for easy rolling and cutting.
meanings.sent3: The superplasticity of the slime made it a fun toy for stretching and squishing.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity had a superplasticity that allowed her to adapt her art style easily.
meanings.sent5: The superplasticity of the playdough made it a favorite among children for sculpting.
